title: Artificial Intelligence: an Overview Specialization
description: Enter the artificial intelligence world
learning_outcomes: Evaluate the ethical implications of AI technologies.
Identify appropriate AI tools and techniques for specific applications.
Explore various subfields of AI, including machine learning and deep learning.
Apply fundamental AI techniques to solve real-world problems.
Analyze and compare different AI approaches and algorithms.
Understand the core concepts and history of Artificial Intelligence.

title: Microsoft Azure Fundamentals AZ-900 Exam Prep Specialization

title: Reinforcement Learning Specialization
description: Master the Concepts of Reinforcement Learning. Implement a complete RL solution and understand how to apply AI tools to solve real-world problems.
learning_outcomes: Apply Policy Gradient methods for solving complex control problems.
Analyze and model sequential decision-making problems using Markov Decision Processes.
Design and implement exploration-exploitation strategies for efficient learning.
Implement various Reinforcement Learning algorithms such as Q-learning, SARSA, and Deep Q-Networks.
Evaluate the performance of Reinforcement Learning agents using appropriate metrics.
Understand the foundations of Reinforcement Learning and its applications.

title: AI Fundamentals
description: Learn the AI skills top companies are looking for.
prerequisites: Be familiar with basic Python
No prior experience with ML or AI is required, but a student taking this course should already:
See the Technology Requirements for using Udacity
Understand basic programming skills, such as writing conditional and loop statements in any language, preferably Python
Have basic knowledge of machine learning (recommended but not required)
Have experience setting up Azure compute resources (recommended but not required)
Have basic statistics knowledge, such as calculating standard deviation and using linear regression methods
Be familiar with basic concepts of linear algebra, probability and statistics

title: Machine Learning: Unsupervised Learning
description: Conversations on Analyzing Data
prerequisites: Udacity's Intro to Statistics, especially Lessons 8, 9 and 10, may be a useful refresher
See the Technology Requirements for using Udacity
This class will assume that you have programming experience as you will be expected to work with python libraries such as numpy and scikit
A good grasp of probability and statistics is also required
An introductory course like Udacity's Introduction to Artificial Intelligence also provides a helpful background for this course
